sbsun.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of the San Bernardino Sun, a newspaper serving San Bernardino County and Riverside County, California.  

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The San Bernardino Sun is owned by Digital First Media, a private company that owns nearly 100 newspapers in the U.S., including the Los Angeles Daily News and the Denver Post. Digital First generates revenue from subscriptions and advertising on its printed publications and digital products. It also operates AdTaxi, a programmatic advertising product for businesses.

Digital First is controlled by Alden Global Capital, a New York-based hedge fund that has been the subject of controversy for substantial staff cuts at its media properties. In 2018, staff at The Denver Post and the Bay Area News Group engaged in a series of public protests and published editorials against Alden’s ownership.

The site derives revenue from advertising and a paywall for subscribers.

Content

Sbsun.com provides breaking and in-depth news, and sports, arts, and entertainment coverage for the San Bernardino region.

The site emphasizes the outlet’s more ambitious articles, such as an examination of teacher-student sex and how a local school district has dealt with the issue, and reporting on a manufacturer of artificial turf whose product is alleged to have used inferior materials.

National and international news is provided by The Associated Press.

Credibility

Articles on the site are well-sourced and often based on firsthand reporting, Headlines are fact-based and accurately reflect the content of articles. Opinion is published separately from news content. The site posts a corrections policy, and provides a page detailing recent corrections.  

Transparency

Top editors and company executives are listed on the website’s contact page. Stories have bylines and link to reporters’ biographical information. Ownership by Digital First Media is disclosed, and advertising is clearly labeled.

History

The San Bernardino Sun was founded in 1894. It came under the umbrella of Digital First Media -- then known as MediaNews Group -- in 1999. SBsun.com was registered in 1997.
